Hi Anmol,

Take a look at
ScopePlusOneDecideRule
and TransclusionDecideRule.

If TransclusionDecideRule is two broad and you only want to follow 
redirects (R) take a look at
HopsPathMatchesRegExpDecideRule.

I hope this helps.
Take care,
i.

> Hi,
> 
> A lil help would be greatly appreciated. I am curious about how Heritrix 
> is handling Redirects.
> 
> Per my understanding, The HTTP Method in the source is by default not 
> allowed to follow the Redirection. The Transclusion filter checks for 
> Refer Hops to ensure that the URI is in scope or not.
> 
> Assuming this is true, I wished to Crawl a Host+1 level outlinks, for 
> which I employed the Decider Rule Sequence Based on SURT prefixes and 
> placed "Check Via" to true, undoubtedly it produces the desired result, 
> but then I face this issue, if the (+1) link returns a Redirect 
> (301/302) then that page does not get fetched as I understand that the 
> Referer page does not fall within the SURT prefix set anymore. Am I 
> interpreting the problem correctly? If yes, then is there is a solution 
> to this issue.
> 
> Anmol
> 
> 
>
